alert.note: Alert for Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 4:34AM EST until December 18 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Susquehanna and Wayne. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 434 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Montrose, Susquehanna, Forest City, Susquehanna Depot, Springville, Harford, Hallstead, New Milford, Great Bend, Lanesboro, Hop Bottom, Thompson, Union Dale, Starrucca, Gibson, Lenoxville, Royal, Glenwood, Starruca and Pleasant Mount. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
